alert.note: Alert for Bolivar Peninsula; Brazoria Islands; Coastal Galveston; Coastal Harris; Galveston Island; Matagorda Islands (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued October 03 at 3:01AM CDT until October 04 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Strong rip currents on Gulf-facing beaches and possible minor coastal flooding. * WHERE...Gulf-facing beaches, including the Matagorda Peninsula, Brazoria County beaches, Galveston Island and the Bolivar Peninsula. * WHEN...Strong rip currents through at least Wednesday morning; for minor coastal flooding, a short time period around high tide Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Some water on low lying roads and property. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A summary of potential impacts from minor coastal flooding: * Slight overwash of water at the intersection of Highway 87 and Highway 124 and other lowest-lying locations on the Bolivar Peninsula. * Waves could runup close to parts of the Galveston Seawall, as well as Blue Water Highway and Beach Drive in Surfside. * Water may come near the north approach roadway to the Lynchburg Ferry, lowest portions of Toddville Road in Seabrook, and portions of Highway 6 between Interstate 45 and Hitchcock.
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Bolivar Peninsula; Brazoria Islands; Coastal Galveston; Coastal Harris; Galveston Island; Matagorda Islands
